thread.title: Mets officially set NLDS roster: Is Steven Matz on it?
thread.title_full: Mets officially set NLDS roster: Is Steven Matz on it?

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Mets officially set NLDS roster: Is Steven Matz on it?
text:
Comments 
LOS ANGELES â€” The Mets NLDS roster is set and Steven Matz is on it. 
The rookie left-hander felt good after his nearly 90-pitch outing Thursday and is on the Mets' staff to face the Dodgers. Rosters were due at 1 p.m. ET Friday. Game 1 starts Friday night at 9:45 p.m. ET . 
Matz had been dealing with a back issue for the last two weeks and has not pitched in a game since Sept. 24. The rookie went 4-0 with a 2.27 ERA in six starts this season. 
The Mets will likely start Matz in Game 4. He is not expected to join the team until they return to New York. 
"In a perfect world that would be the plan," manager Terry Collins said Thursday. "We'll make adjustments as we go but we certainly hope he's part of the rotation." 
If Matz can't start, then Bartolo Colon would be next in line for the opportunity, although Collins didn't completely discount that Jon Niese had a chance. METS 2015 NLDS PREVIEW : How Mets saved their 2015 season and nearly didn't get Yoenis Cespedes in 1 ridiculous week in July 
Jacob deGrom will start Game 1 . Noah Syndergaard will start Game 2. Matt Harvey starts Game 3. 
Sean Gilmartin will stay around as an emergency arm. Niese will be the Mets' lone lefty out of the bullpen, although Tyler Clippard will has an excellent track record against left-handed batters this season. The Mets will depend on Clippard and Reed in the late innings before getting to Jeurys Familia. 
You can see the entire roster below.
